Latest Places New Real Estate Favorite Cypress Woods Golf & Country Club New Dining Favorite Cafe Marquise New Real Estate Favorite Royal Palm Coast Realtors Association New Shopping Favorite Caloosahatchee Cannabis Company New Professional Directory Favorite Stilwell Enterprises & Restaurant Group View all ‚ÄúNesting in Naples‚Äù at Riptide Brewing Company By Staff on October 22, 2020 1. Naples‚Äô Vice Mayor Terry Hutchison, Naples United Director Enoch Showunmi and Ver√≥nica Docio, Naples United founder and vice president. The start of October was celebrated with a crisp pineapple IPA. Vera Jaye, owner of Jaye Design and creator of the Nesting in Naples podcast, recently hosted a gathering at the newly reopened Riptide Brewing Company. During the event, there was a ribbon-cutting ceremony that brought together Naples community leaders and speakers from Naples United, the Above Board Chamber of Florida, and Cypress Cove Landkeepers to share more information about exciting new things happening in the local Naples‚Äô area. Riptide provided tours of their brewery for guests throughout the evening and offered a specialty drink named after Vera Jaye‚Äôs podcast, called ‚ÄúNesting In Naples.‚Äù The featured ‚ÄúNesting in Naples‚Äù drink is an IPA that has a crisp tart taste with a hint of pineapple. The proceeds of this specialty drink raised funds that will be donated to Naples United to support their grassroot soccer program. The event included Riptide‚Äôs permanent food truck, Kraken Kitchen, owned by Sea Salt‚Äôs former chef, Freddie Mosqueda. Ending the night, there was a giveaway featuring a one hour design consultation with Vera Jaye (valued at $550), an official Naples United Jersey, and a box of Riptide swag items. 2. Ribbon Cutting Event sponsored by Naples‚Äô Above Board Chamber featuring Riptide Leadership, Naples United Leadership, Vera Jaye of Jaye Design (black top), Freddie Mosqueda, owner of Kraken Kitchen and Bowers PR team. Florida Weekly welcomes submissions for the Society pages from charity galas and fundraising events, club meetings and other to- dos around town. We need 300- dpi photographs of groups of two or more people, facing the camera and identifi ed by first and last names. Questions? Email editor Eric Strachan at eric. strachan@floridaweekly.com . 3. Terry Hutchison, Naples vice mayor and Vera Jaye, owner of Jaye Design. 4. Naples United Leadership, Ver√≥nica Docio, founder and vice president; Vicente Sandoval, founder and president; Enoch Showunmi, director; and Andres Cortes, player. 5. Riptide team, Chris West, owner; Christian Johnson, beertender/sales; Lynden Preuss, operations manager; and Freddie Mosqueda, Kraken Kitchen owner. 6. Kraken Kitchen Corn Salsa appetizer 7. Vera Jaye specialty drink. 8. Freddie Mosqueda, Kraken Kitchen food truck owner. Leave a Reply Cancel reply Your email address will not be published. Jeff previously worked as a newspaper reporter for the Lawrence Eagle-Tribune, the Boston TAB and the Metrowest Daily News, and has freelanced for publications like Slate, Boston Magazine, Self, George, Commonwealth, and the Chronicle of Philanthropy. Ray‚Äôs conversational style and meticulous research have earned him widespread praise from both guests and listeners. RipTide Brewing condensing operations to one taproom - Florida Beer News Skip to content Home About About Florida Beer News Working with Florida Beer News Blog Destination Florida Breweries Map Store Subscribe to Florida Beer News Contact Us Breaking Tom Moench, craft beer pioneer and founder of Orange Blossom Brewing, passed away Friday Tripping Animals Brewing Company is hosting Miami‚Äôs Premier Food Event October 18th Tampa‚Äôs Woven Water Brewing celebrates five years with beer releases and more Dogfish Head Debuts NEW Variety Pack Featuring Crowd-Sourced Fan-Favorites Angry Chair Brewing celebrates Brimley‚Äôs Brunch this weekend Fort Myers‚Äô Point Ybel Brewing Company celebrates Cool & Crispy Fest 2025 Pouring Profits: What Florida Bartenders Really Take Home Wed. Sep 10th, 2025 Florida Beer News Florida's comprehensive beer news website. Home About Working with Florida Beer News Locations Tampa Bay Orlando South Florida Jacksonville Tallahassee Florida Breweries Map Podcasts Store Contact Subscribe Florida Beer News Fort Myers/ Naples South Florida RipTide Brewing condensing operations to one taproom By mark Sep 19, 2024 # beer in florida # bonita springs beer # bonita springs brewery # craft beer # florida beer # florida beer news # florida brewery # florida craft beer # Floridian craft beer # fort myers beer # naples beer # riptide beer # riptide brewing # south florida beer # south florida breweries # southwest florida beer Craft brewers around the country are right-sizing their operations, and Florida continues to see the same trend among its breweries. Southwest Florida‚Äôs RipTide Brewing Company announced on September 2nd that it would be parting ways with its Naples Taproom and operating solely from its Bonita Springs location. While many times decisions like this are difficult, they are better than the alternative of closing operations altogether. From RipTide Brewing Company To Our Amazing Community, After nearly 9 incredible years, we‚Äôve made the difficult decision to part ways with our original taproom in Naples and consolidate into our Bonita Springs taproom. The Naples taproom has been our home, where we poured our first pints, shared countless memories, and built the foundation of who we are today. We are endlessly grateful to our loyal guests and neighbors, who made it such a special place. While saying goodbye is never easy, we believe this change will allow us to better focus on serving the SWFL community from our larger space in Bonita. Our commitment to crafting great beer and creating a welcoming space for all remains stronger than ever. We hope you‚Äôll join us in Bonita for this new era together. We want to take a moment to express our deepest gratitude to the incredible staff who have been the heart and soul of our Naples taproom. Their dedication, passion, and hard work have made this place feel like home to so many, and we couldn‚Äôt be more thankful for their contributions over the years. Decisions like this are never easy and we are 100% committed to supporting them through this transition. They are forever a part of the Riptide Family. Although bittersweet, We‚Äôre pleased to share that our original taproom will be in great hands as it transitions to new ownership- Kaleidoscope Beer Company . We believe they will give our beloved taproom the love and attention it deserves, honoring its history while bringing their own unique touch. We‚Äôre confident that Kaleidoscope Beer Company will continue to make this space a welcoming home for craft beer lovers, just as it has always been. We hope you‚Äôll join us in supporting them as they embark on their own journey in the space we‚Äôve called home. A brief statement from their owner, Bill: ‚ÄúKaleidoscope Beer Company is thrilled to be given this opportunity to take a well-established and loved brewery on a new journey. Riptide Naples is such a beautiful place and we‚Äôre excited to grow on that base. We look forward to serving Naples, and beyond, the best that we can.‚Äù While Riptide has officially ceased operations at the Naples taproom, the physical transition to Kaleidoscope will be a gradual process throughout September. During this time, Kaleidoscope will slowly begin to make their mark on the space, allowing for a smooth and seamless transition. We‚Äôre working closely with the new owners to ensure this beloved taproom remains a welcoming spot for our community throughout the changeover. You can still expect the same warm atmosphere, friendly faces, and great beer as we wind down this chapter together. We hope you‚Äôll join us during this special transition period to raise a glass, share stories, and celebrate all that this taproom has meant to us. With Gratitude, Riptide Brewing Company About RipTide Brewing Company Riptide Brewing Company is a female, family-owned and operated business that started here in the heart of Naples, Florida. We aspire to live by the Southwest Florida lifestyle and therefore try to stay as involved in our community as possible by supporting our local business, charities, and organizations. Post navigation Boca Raton‚Äôs Barrel of Monks Brewing is releasing Wizard in Pink to benefit breast cancer charities J.
